docs.title: CreatureCraft
docs.text:
This is my repo and collected information on my work-in-progress interconnected subsystem system called "Creature Craft"

This maps the process of acquiring, and using, components known as Essences to create and enhance other items and abilities.

So far it consists of: - Hindercraft - Harvestcraft - Distillcraft - Forgecraft - Cookcraft

Future subsystems will include: - Distillcraft - Brewcraft

docs.title: How to Use This Reference
docs.text:
Duration by Category:

  • Sustenance: 1 hour × tag level (max 24h) – Environmental protection
  • Enhancement: 30 min × tag level (max 10h) – Combat/skill boosts
  • Utility: 30 min × tag level (max 10h) – Special capabilities

Symbols:

  • @ = Needs review/refinement
  • ~ = No application for this category

docs.title: COMMON PATTERNS
docs.text:
Agent Creation (Venom/Paralyze/Disease/Confusion):

  • 1 minute to create
  • One object at a time (new replaces old)
  • DC = 10 + your level
  • Lasts until triggered or duration ends
  • Cannot treat food/drinks/worn items

Touch Abilities (Healing/Drain):

  • 1 action, touch range
  • Cooldown prevents spam (10-30 min)
  • Strategic timing required

Sustained Effects (Charm/Dark/Sense):

  • Require setup time (1-10 min)
  • Need continuous effort or conditions
  • End if conditions break

docs.title: QUICK LOOKUP: COMMON NEEDS
docs.text:
Need Resistance? Fire, Cold, Acid, Lightning, Sonic, Force, Mental (Psychic), Poison (Venom), Physical (Earth)

Need Movement? Flight (fly 20 ft), Swim (swim speed), Burrow (15 ft), Mobility (+10 all speeds)

Need Social Bonuses? Charm (+2 Diplomacy/Deception), Sonic (+2 Performance/Intimidation), Light (+2 in bright areas)

Need Combat Bonuses? Sharp (+1 attacks), Defense (+1 AC), Fire (+2 Reflex), Lightning (+1 Initiative)

Need Detection? Vision (see invisibility), Scent (track 30 ft), Sense (sentinel awareness), Magical (detect magic)

Need Healing? Healing (2d8 touch), Regeneration (remove wounded), Drain (vampiric)

For full details on limitations, specific mechanics, and edge cases, refer to the comprehensive version.

docs.title: CookCraft Subsystem
docs.text: Creature Component Cuisine

docs.title: What Is CookCraft?
docs.text:
CookCraft transforms harvested creature components into temporary consumables. Unlike permanent crafting or complex alchemy, CookCraft provides short-term benefits that support adventure activities through simple cooking mechanics.

Key Benefits:

  • Convert creature materials into beneficial consumables
  • Recipe categories determine how tag powers manifest
  • Prepare for adventures with environmental protection, performance boosts, and special capabilities
  • Create economic value from harvested materials

No Recipe Requirements: Anyone can cook creature components - there are no recipes to learn or discover. The knowledge is simply choosing which category effect you want from your component. A [Fire] component can provide fire protection (Sustenance), improved reflexes (Enhancement), or ignition capability (Utility) based on how you prepare it.

docs.title: Basic Process
docs.text:
1. Choose Recipe: Select category and food form
  2. Gather Components: One special + appropriate mundane components
  3. Make Check: Roll Survival or Crafting vs DC
  4. Cook Time: 30 minutes (field) or 1 hour (camp)
  5. Results: Create consumables based on success

docs.title: Difficulty Class
docs.text:
DC = 14 + Tag Level

  • Tag Level: From the special component used (0 for mundane-only)
  • Batch Cooking: +2 DC per additional serving beyond the first

docs.title: Skills
docs.text:
Choose based on approach:

  • Survival: Traditional cooking, field preparation, natural methods
  • Crafting: Technical precision, equipment usage, refined techniques

docs.title: Degrees of Success
docs.text:
• Critical Success: Create 2 servings
  • Success: Create 1 serving
  • Failure: Components consumed, no result
  • Critical Failure: Components destroyed + Sickened 1 for 1 hour

docs.title: Core Principle
docs.text: Effect magnitude is fixed by recipe category. Higher tag levels provide longer duration, not stronger effects.

docs.title: Duration by Category
docs.text:
Base duration multiplied by tag level:

  • Sustenance: 1 hour x tag level (max 24 hours)
  • Enhancement: 30 minutes x tag level (max 10 hours)
  • Utility: 30 minutes x tag level (max 10 hours)

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• [Fire 5] Sustenance: Fire resistance 5 for 5 hours
  • [Fire 12] Enhancement: +2 Reflex saves for 360 minutes (6 hours)
  • [Flight 8] Utility: 20-foot fly speed for 240 minutes (4 hours)

docs.title: The Simple Truth
docs.text:
[Special Component] + [Mundane Components] + [Category] = Effect

There are no complex recipes to learn. If you have a [Fire] component and some meat, you can cook it. The category you choose (Sustenance, Enhancement, Utility) determines what benefit you get from that [Fire] essence.

docs.title: Core Rules
docs.text:
One Component, One Effect:

  • Each recipe uses ONE special component
  • Adding more special components doesn't enhance the effect
  • Save extra components for additional meals

docs.title: Batch Cooking by Category
docs.text:
Utility Recipes:

  • Always single-serving
  • Special capabilities are personal (can't share fly speed or invisibility)
  • Perfect for using low-level components

Enhancement/Sustenance Recipes:

  • Can split duration among multiple servings
  • Example: [Fire 12] Enhancement = 120 min solo OR 40 min for 3 people
  • DC increases by +2 per additional serving

docs.title: What Doesn't Work
docs.text:
• [Fire 5] + [Fire 5] → [Fire 10] effect
  • [Fire 5] + [Sharp 3] → both effects at once
  • Multiple components don't stack or enhance

docs.title: Recipe Categories
docs.text: Recipe categories are simply different ways to prepare components. The same [Fire] component can be cooked three different ways, each extracting a different benefit from its essence:

docs.title: Sustenance
docs.text:
Slow-cooked for lasting nourishment

Tag Interpretations (Fixed Effects):

  • [Fire] → Fire resistance 5
  • [Cold] → Cold resistance 5
  • [Acid] → Acid resistance 5
  • [Lightning] → Lightning resistance 5
  • [Sonic] → Sonic resistance 5
  • [Venom] → Poison resistance 5
  • [Vision] → Reduce light/dark penalties by 1 step
  • [Sense] → Sentinel Awareness (secret check after 10 min)
  • [Regeneration] → Remove wounded (1 min after combat)
  • [Mundane] → Basic nutrition and fatigue removal

Duration: 1 hour x tag level (max 24 hours) Example: [Fire 5] Sustenance = Fire resistance 5 for 5 hours

docs.title: Enhancement
docs.text:
Prepared to boost abilities

Tag Interpretations (Fixed Effects):

  • [Fire] → +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex saves
  • [Cold] → +1 status bonus to AC
  • [Acid] → +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves
  • [Lightning] → +1 status bonus to Initiative
  • [Sonic] → +2 circumstance bonus to Performance & Intimidation
  • [Venom] → +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves vs poison
  • [Sharp] → +1 item bonus to attack rolls
  • [Vision] → +2 circumstance bonus to Perception (visual)
  • [Flight] → +2 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics
  • [Magical] → +1 circumstance bonus to spell DCs & attacks

Duration: 30 minutes x tag level (max 10 hours) Example: [Sharp 8] Enhancement = +1 to attacks for 240 minutes (4 hours)

docs.title: Utility
docs.text:
Prepared to grant special capabilities

Tag Interpretations (Fixed Effects):

  • [Fire] → Ignite (light fires, melt wax, heat objects)
  • [Flight] → Gain 20-foot fly speed (hover)
  • [Vision] → See invisibility
  • [Water] → Breathe underwater
  • [Burrow] → Gain 15-foot burrow speed through earth
  • [Sharp] → Ignore object Hardness up to 5 (non-magical objects)
  • [Magical] → Read magic (understand magical writing)
  • [Venom] → Create contact poison (2d4 damage, Fort DC 10+level)
  • [Charm] → Sustained Charm (1 min setup, maintain conversation)

Duration: 30 minutes x tag level (max 10 hours) Example: [Flight 6] Utility = 20-foot fly speed for 180 minutes

Note: Not every tag has a natural Utility application - some components are better suited for Sustenance or Enhancement.

docs.title: The Basic Formula
docs.text:
Every recipe = [Special Component] + [Mundane Components] + [Category Choice]

  • Special component provides the tagged power
  • Mundane components make it edible food
  • Category choice determines how the power manifests

docs.title: Special Components
docs.text:
• One per recipe: Each recipe uses exactly ONE special component
  • No stacking: Additional components don't enhance effects
  • Batch cooking: Enhancement/Sustenance can split duration among servings
  • Utility restriction: Utility recipes are always single-serving (special capabilities cannot be shared)
  • Tag mixing: Cannot mix different special tag types in one recipe

docs.title: Mundane Components & Food Forms
docs.text:
The mundane components you use determine what type of food you make. All forms provide the same mechanical effect but create different narrative experiences:

Stew/Soup: [Meat] + [Fat] + [Bone] or [Organs]

  • Natural choice for batch cooking
  • Camp cooking only (needs pot and time)

Roast/Grilled: [Meat] + [Fat]

  • Simple and reliable
  • Can be field-cooked

Jerky/Preserved: [Meat] only

  • Takes longer to prepare
  • Travels well, good for Sustenance

Broth/Tonic: [Bone] + [Organs] or [Blood]

  • Light and quick to consume

Pie/Pastry: [Meat] + [Fat] + trade goods (flour, etc.)

  • Requires civilization supplies
  • Impressive for social situations

docs.title: Batch Cooking Requirements
docs.text:
• Add 1 mundane component per extra serving
  • Example: Stew for 3 people needs 3Ãƒâ€” the mundane components

docs.title: Cooking Time
docs.text:
Field Cooking: 30 minutes

  • Quick preparations over open flame
  • Limited to simpler food forms (roasts, jerky)
  • Requires portable cooking kit

Camp Cooking: 1 hour

  • Full meal preparation with proper setup
  • Enables all food forms (stews, soups, pies)
  • Better for batch cooking

docs.title: Equipment
docs.text:
Portable Cooking Kit (5 gp, 3 Bulk)

  • Basic pots, utensils, portable heat source
  • No penalty to checks
  • Enables field cooking

Professional Cooking Tools (25 gp, 5 Bulk)

  • Quality cookware, precision utensils, spices
  • +1 item bonus to CookCraft checks
  • Makes field cooking more versatile

docs.title: Food Form Limitations
docs.text:
Some food forms require specific conditions:

  • Stews/Soups: Need camp setup and proper pots
  • Pies/Pastries: Require trade goods (flour, etc.)
  • Jerky: Takes longer but can be done while traveling
  • Roasts: Can be field-cooked with basic equipment

docs.title: Fixed Effect Magnitudes
docs.text: Effects are determined by recipe category, NOT tag level: - All elemental damage Sustenance recipes ([Fire], [Cold], [Acid], [Lightning], [Sonic]) give resistance 5 - All [Fire] Enhancement recipes give +10 movement speed - All [Flight] Utility recipes give 20-foot fly speed - Higher tag levels provide longer duration, not stronger effects

docs.title: Stacking Rules
docs.text:
• Same recipe type doesn't stack (higher bonus applies)
  • Different categories stack normally (Enhancement + Utility + Sustenance)
  • Cannot consume same recipe until duration expires
  • All effects provide item bonuses (following PF2e item bonus rules)

docs.title: Example Recipes
docs.text: Note: Recipe names are purely narrative. "Drake Fire Roast" is mechanically identical to "Goblin Fire Stew" if both use [Fire] components of the same level.

docs.title: Wolf Pack Jerky
docs.text:
• Category: Sustenance
  • Food Form: Jerky ([Meat] only)
  • Components: [Meat] x1
  • DC: 14 (no special component)
  • Effect: Removes fatigued, provides 8 hours satiation
  • Note: Simple trail food using only mundane ingredients

docs.title: Drake Fire Roast
docs.text:
• Category: Enhancement
  • Food Form: Roast ([Meat] + [Fat])
  • Components: [Fire 7] + drake [Meat] + drake [Fat]
  • DC: 21 (14 + 7)
  • Effect: +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex saves for 210 minutes (3.5 hours)

docs.title: Harpy Wing Stew
docs.text:
• Category: Utility
  • Food Form: Stew ([Meat] + [Fat] + [Bone])
  • Components: [Flight 6] + harpy [Meat] + harpy [Fat] + harpy [Bone]
  • DC: 20 (14 + 6)
  • Effect: Gain 20-foot fly speed for 180 minutes (3 hours)

Note: Single serving only (Utility recipes don't batch - can't share fly speed)

docs.title: Party Protection Soup (Batch)
docs.text:
• Category: Sustenance
  • Food Form: Soup ([Meat] + [Fat] + [Bone])
  • Components: [Fire 18] + [Meat] x3 + [Fat] x3 + [Bone] x3
  • DC: 36 (14 + 18 + 4 for 2 extra servings)
    • Effect: 3 servings, each person gets Fire Resistance 5 for 6 hours Note: Single component split among 3 people (18 hours / 3 = 6 hours each)

docs.title: Dangerous Components
docs.text:
Some tags require careful handling:

  • [Fire/Lightning]: Failure = 1d6 energy damage
  • [Venom]: Failure = Sickened 1 (blocks further cooking)
  • [Magical]: Failure = Stupefied 1 for 10 minutes

Professional tools reduce failure consequences by one step.

docs.title: With HarvestCraft
docs.text:
• All harvested components work in recipes
  • Mundane materials provide base requirements
  • Special tags enable enhanced effects
  • Combat-harvested components work normally

docs.title: With HinderCraft
docs.text:
• Recently hindered features may be easier to harvest
  • Hindered components could provide fresher materials
  • No special mechanical interaction required

docs.title: Economic Value
docs.text:
• Mundane recipes: 1-5 gp value
  • Enhancement recipes: 10-50 gp value
  • Utility recipes: 25-100 gp value

docs.title: Recipe Planning
docs.text:
1. Choose category (determines effect type)
  2. Select special component (determines tag and duration)
  3. Choose food form (based on available mundane components)
  4. Decide portions (single or batch for Enhancement/Sustenance)
  5. Calculate DC (14 + tag level + batch modifier if applicable)
  6. Cook (30 min field, 1 hour camp)

docs.title: Duration Formula
docs.text:
• Sustenance: 1 hour x tag level (max 24 hours)
  • Enhancement: 30 minutes x tag level (max 10 hours)
  • Utility: 30 minutes x tag level (max 10 hours)

docs.title: Batch Cooking
docs.text:
• Utility: No batching - always single serving (special capabilities cannot be shared)
  • Enhancement/Sustenance: Can split duration among servings
  • DC Calculation: Base DC + 2 per extra serving
  • Duration Split: Total duration / servings = time per person
  • Important: Cannot combine multiple special components for enhanced effects

Remember: CookCraft is simple - one component, one effect. Choose your category to determine how the component's power manifests. Utility recipes are personal capabilities (no batching), while Enhancement and Sustenance can be shared meals (split duration). The mundane components you use determine the food form (stew, roast, jerky) but not the mechanical effect. This system turns leftover creature parts into meaningful tactical choices without complex rules.

docs.title: HarvestCraft
docs.text: Player Handout

docs.title: What Is HarvestCraft?
docs.text:
HarvestCraft allows you to extract valuable materials from defeated creatures. These materials can be used for crafting, cooking, and trade. The system uses the universal Tag framework, meaning components work consistently across all subsystems.

Key Benefits: - Convert defeated creatures into crafting materials - Acquire tagged components for enhanced crafting - Gather mundane materials for survival and trade - Integrate with combat tactics through Hindercraft

docs.title: How to Harvest
docs.text: Declare Intent: Choose what type of component you want to extract Make Check: Roll Survival against the component's DC Apply Results: Gain materials based on your degree of success

docs.title: Difficulty Class
docs.text: DC = 14 + Tag Level + Difficulty Modifier - Tag Level: Equals the creature's Challenge Rating - Difficulty Modifier: Based on extraction complexity (+0 to +10)

docs.title: Degrees of Success
docs.text: Critical Success: Gain 2 components of the chosen type Success: Gain 1 component of the chosen type Failure: Gain 0 components + condition that blocks further harvesting (component remains intact) Critical Failure: Gain 0 components + condition that blocks harvesting + component permanently destroyed

docs.title: Failure Consequences
docs.text:
Each component type has specific conditions that represent extraction dangers:

[Fire] Components: Take 1d6 fire damage - "You cannot attempt Harvest actions while injured by fire damage" [Venom] Components: Gain Sickened 1 - "You cannot attempt Harvest actions while Sickened from venom" [Sharp] Components: Gain Clumsy 1 for 10 minutes - "You cannot attempt Harvest actions while Clumsy from injury" [Magical] Components: Gain Stupefied 1 for 10 minutes - "You cannot attempt Harvest actions while Stupefied" [Sensory] Components: Gain Dazzled for 10 minutes - "You cannot attempt Harvest actions while Dazzled" [Flight] Components: Gain Prone + Clumsy 1 for 1 minute - "You cannot attempt Harvest actions while Clumsy"

Recovery: Remove conditions through normal means (time, healing, magic) to resume harvesting

docs.title: Special Components (Tagged)
docs.text: What They Are: Magical or enhanced creature features with power levels Tag Level: Equals creature's Challenge Rating Examples: Dragon fire glands [Fire 17], Owlbear claws [Sharp 7], Spider venom [Venom 3] Uses: High-value crafting, magical enhancement, specialized applications

docs.title: Mundane Materials (Untagged)
docs.text: What They Are: Basic biological materials for survival and trade No Power Level: Simple functional materials Examples: Meat, hide, bone, fat Uses: Cooking, basic crafting, economic trade

docs.title: Special Components: Precision Extraction
docs.text: Time: 10 minutes per component type (exploration activity) Process: Careful extraction of specific organs or features Why Consistent: Extracting a fire gland requires the same precision work regardless of creature size

docs.title: Mundane Materials: Bulk Processing
docs.text:
Time: Varies by creature size (camp activity) - Tiny: 15 minutes - Small: 20 minutes - Medium: 30 minutes - Large: 60 minutes - Huge: 90 minutes - Gargantuan: 180 minutes (3 hours)

Process: Volume-based work like butchering meat or processing hide

docs.title: Tool Requirements
docs.text: Without Proper Tools: -2 circumstance penalty to all Harvest checks With Harvesting Tools: No penalty (standard expectation) Quality Tools: Item bonuses for expert and masterwork versions

docs.title: Harvesting Tools
docs.text:
Contents: Skinning knives, bone saws, extraction picks, cutting boards, collection containers, preservation salts, measuring tools, binding materials

Tool Quality: - Basic Harvesting Tools: No penalty (2 gp, 2 Bulk) - Expert Harvesting Tools: +1 item bonus (20 gp, 2 Bulk) - Master Harvesting Tools: +2 item bonus (200 gp, 2 Bulk) - Legendary Harvesting Tools: +3 item bonus (2,000 gp, 2 Bulk)

docs.title: When Available
docs.text: Requirements: A creature feature has been Hindered this round through the Hindercraft system Limited to External Features: Only appendages and external organs can be severed in combat

docs.title: Combat Harvesting Action
docs.text: Action Cost: 2 Actions Requirements: Must be adjacent to creature, feature must be external type Skill Check: Survival vs DC (14 + Tag Level + 2) No Tools Required: Uses weapons and combat methods

docs.title: Combat Harvestable Features
docs.text:
Can Be Harvested in Combat: - [Sharp]: Claws, teeth, spines, horns - [Defense]: External scales, armor plates - [Flight]: Wing membranes, feathers - [Venom]: External stingers, tail barbs - [Sensory]: Eyes, external sensory organs - Some Mundane: External hide, loose bones

Cannot Be Harvested in Combat: - [Fire]: Internal breath organs - [Magical]: Internal magical cores - [Vital]: Internal organs

docs.title: Combat Harvesting Results
docs.text: Critical Success: Gain 1 component Success: Gain 1 component Failure: No component gained Critical Failure: No component + creature makes opportunity attack against you

docs.title: Standard Harvesting: Owlbear (CR 7)
docs.text:
Special Components Available (10 minutes each): - Claws [Sharp 7]: DC 21 (simple extraction) - Enhanced Eyes [Sensory 7]: DC 23 (moderate extraction)

Mundane Materials Available (60 minutes total for Large creature): - Hide, Meat, Bone: DC 21 each, yields 2-3 bulk per type

Strategy: Extract valuable claws and eyes quickly (20 minutes), then decide if bulk processing is worth the additional hour

docs.title: Combat Example: Hindered Dragon
docs.text: Setup: Dragon's wing was hindered during combat Opportunity: Wing membrane [Flight] is now exposed and damaged Action: Spend 2 actions on Combat Harvesting Check: Survival vs DC 36 (14 + 20 + 2 for combat conditions) Risk: If critical failure, dragon gets opportunity attack Reward: Immediate [Flight 20] component worth significant value

docs.title: Basic Harvesting Checklist
docs.text:
1. Identify creature's harvestable features
  2. Choose component type to extract
  3. Check if you have proper tools (-2 penalty without)
  4. Roll Survival vs DC (14 + Tag Level + Difficulty Modifier)
  5. Apply results and conditions
  6. Repeat for other components (if not blocked by conditions)

docs.title: Time Planning
docs.text:
• Special components: 10 minutes each
  • Mundane materials: 15 minutes to 3 hours based on creature size
  • Combat harvesting: 2 actions during combat

docs.title: Risk Management
docs.text:
• Failure: Temporary condition, can retry after recovery
  • Critical failure: Component destroyed permanently + condition
  • Combat harvesting: Risk opportunity attack on critical failure

Remember: Each component type is extracted separately, conditions block all harvesting until removed, and combat harvesting only works on external features that have been hindered this round.
